abstract: United States will expand its Special Operations force by more than 50 in Iraq to battle Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The expanded force will include about 50 soldiers who will work with Syrian, Arab and Kurdish forces battling militants with the Islamic State.

headline.main: U.S. Special Operations Force in Iraq to Grow, Pentagon Says
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Officials Say They’ll Bolster Special Operations Force in Iraq

snippet: The expanded force will include about 50 soldiers who will work with Syrian, Arab and Kurdish forces battling militants with the Islamic State.
